entries.meaning: A person who stands up for something, as contrasted to a bystander who remains inactive.
examples: Professor Reeves has been a full-time upstander on Sudan since 1999, back when the people being slaughtered there were Christians in the south of the country.

entries.meaning: (archaic) One of the upright handlebars on a traditional Inuit sled.
examples: With quick presence of mind, Ootah grasped the rear upstander of the sled, which had begun to slide to and fro, and planted his harpoon in the ice.
